result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. Kasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain an HSED during the pendency of probation term.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

In WC jail

1:28 pm case called. Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. State moves to amend Count 1 to Poss THC (Misd.) & addition of Count 2-Obstructing an Officer 946.41(1). Defendant concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts amendment by State.   Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 18 months. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant must complete an HSED. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-05-2015 01:30 pm

Case called @ 2:04 p.m. Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader - due to a pending ME matter the DE will be requesting another date for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Zilles-requests plea/sentencing date approximately 3 months out for programming to begin assisting the defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
State's
Defendant's
Status conference on January 28, 2015 at 02:05 pm.

Case Called @ 3:20 PM: Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Paul Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  Def Counsel has already discussed the possible TAD Court referral.  Def has already served a 30 day sanction sentence - no revocation.  Application for eval will be pursued.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 02:05 pm.
Initial appearance on December 16, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  ADA argues for signature bond due to PO Hold in place.   SPD has no position on bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
